column4: Hello... if am using ubuntu in virtualbox as guest and its very very slow, are there other ubuntu products to use? will it be any better?
hmm Ubuntu in Virtualbox with Windows as host?
yes
oh dear
Windows as the host OS :(  I hope this is only for getting a feel for Ubuntu
how much RAM do you have?
1gb
and am using a netbook ! lol
Maybe that's why it's slow then
would be better probably to put it on for real,  but in that case  may as well wait until 9.10, released on October 29th.  also #vbox can probably help you
why wait for 9.10?
a few reasons
performance reasons?
Ext4  is default in 9.10 :)  it's not in 9.04 it's optional, but not perfectly stable.   plus upgrading takes time,  or doing another re install. and so on
do you think if I use kubuntu, xubuntu, lubuntu it would be better for me?
you can have all of those in an Ubuntu install
well maybe lubuntu isn't in the repo I don't know, I haven't done it
would I get better performance with the other products?

well it's a netbook, so the hardware won't be that great,  if Virtualbox is still bad, after doing a bit more RAM and Video memory, or whatever #vbox suggest.   you could try VMware player or server, and even  Microsoft Virtualpc hmm
I  would avoide Microsoft Virtualpc :)  ,but maybe on that netbook it would be better than the others
bought the laptop 2 weeks ago and it had preinstalled windowsxp didnt want to mess with it as am not pro in linux yet
nostalgicBadger  has a point you can try a Live CD,  but right it's a netbook, so you don't even have a CD drive right?  well  you can do Ubuntu from USB
probably, because it's running in a virtual machine, plus  some of us get issues like that with FIrefox in Ubuntu
